alert.note: Alert for Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 27 at 5:41AM AKST until December 27 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST TODAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Snow and freezing rain occurring. Plan on very difficult travel conditions. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 2 inches, are expected. Additional ice accumulation of less than one tenth of an inch expected. The freezing rain will occur along the Alaska Highway, and the the heaviest snow amounts will be north of the Alaska Highway. * WHERE...Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country. * WHEN...Until noon today. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Winds gusting as high as 35 mph will cause areas of blowing and drifting snow. The freezing rain will occur along the Alaska Highway, with the heaviest snow amounts north of the Alaska Highway. Winds, snow and freezing rain will end this afternoon and conditions will improve then. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Weather Advisory for snow and blowing snow means periods of snow and blowing snow will cause travel difficulties. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country
